intro: Delissea sinuata subsp. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in coastal areas and moist woodlands. It plays a significant role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
